compliant.section: Uber uses data (excluding visitor user data) to market Uber and its partners' services.

We will specifically use account, approximate location, device and usage data, preferred language, and trip and order history to provide personalized advertising and marketing communications based on user-observed or inferred location, interests, and characteristics (which may include inferred gender*).

This includes using data for the following purposes:
Sending emails, SMS messages, push notifications, in-app messages, or other communications to market or promote Uber products, services, features, offers, rewards, contests, news, and events.

For example: We may send push notifications to recommend frequently used destinations or favorite merchants for the user, or provide offers or rewards for similar products/merchants via in-app messages based on products or merchants the user has previously ordered.
Displaying personalized ads on third-party apps or websites.
Displaying third-party ads within the Uber app, or displaying third-party ads related to our services.
For example, displaying ads for restaurants or merchants that provide services through the Uber app.
These ads (referred to as "sponsored ads" within the Uber app) include personalized recommendations based on user location and order history.
We also display ads for third-party goods not provided by the Uber app.
These ads may include links to third-party apps or websites.

non_compliant.legal provisions: Article 14 - Special categories of personal data
non_compliant.amend: The policy should explicitly state that inferred gender is not processed as a special category of personal data and that it is processed based on legitimate interests, with clear information about the specific legitimate interests pursued.

non_compliant.amend: The policy should provide clear and concise information about the specific data processing activities, including the purpose, legal basis, and recipients of the data. It should also inform users about their rights, including the right to object to profiling.
